{{infobox character | people=[[Orcs|Orc]] | name=Golfimbul | image=Eytan Eylul Guler - Golfimbul the Wargrider.jpg | caption="Golfimbul the Wargrider" by [[:Category:Images by Eytan Eylul Guler| Eytan Eylul Guler]] | pronun= | othernames= | titles=King of the [[Orcs#Orcs and Goblins|Goblins]] of [[Mount Gram]] | position= | location=[[Mount Gram]]
[[Greenfields]] | affiliation=[[Orcs of the Misty Mountains|Orcs of Mount Gram]] | language=''Presumably'' [[Orkish]] | birth= | birthlocation= | rule= | death={{TA|2747}} | deathlocation=[[Greenfields]] ([[Northfarthing]]) | age= | notablefor=Being in the first "[[Battle of Greenfields|game]]" of [[Golf]] | parentage= | siblings= | spouse= | children= | race= | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Golfimbul''' was a king of the [[Orcs#Orcs and Goblins|Orcs]] of [[Mount Gram]].{{H|Party}} ==History== Golfimbul led a band of Orcs in an invasion of [[the Shire]] in {{TA|2747}}.{{App|TA}} [[Bandobras Took]] met Golfimbul in the [[Northfarthing]] of [[the Shire]] and defeated him in the [[Battle of Greenfields]]. During the battle Bandobras, who was large enough to ride a horse, charged at Golfimbul and knocked off his head with a club. Golfimbul's head flew through the air for 100 yards and went down a rabbit hole. It is said that this is how the game of [[golf]] was invented. ==Etymology== Jim Allan suggests that ''Golfimbul'' has a Scandinavian origin, means "Wind-terrible" and contains the elements ''Gol-'' ("wind") and ''Fimbul'' ("might" or "great").{{HM|IE}}, Giving of Names, p. 226 "Fimbul" is Old Norse for "great".[[Wikipedia:Fimbulwinter#Etymology]] [[Robert Foster]] notes that the connection with the English word "golf" suggests that the name is either fictitious or translated [[Westron]].{{HM|Guide}}, p. 167 ==Other versions of the legendarium== At an early stage in writing ''[[The Hobbit]]'' [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] used the name '''[[Fingolfin]]''' for the Goblin-leader, which also contained the word "golf" for the joke about the origin of the game (although not as prominently as in "Golfimbul").{{HH|Bladorthin}}, p. 39 Many years later, in the never-finished 1960 rewrite of the story, [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] intended to change the name to '''Gulfimbul'''.{{HH|NC1}}, p. 776 [[John D. Rateliff]] speculated that this was either a further evolution of Tolkien's languages or because he was dropping the golf-joke reference.{{HH|NC1}}, note 24, p. 785 The 1960 revision was an effort to "upgrade" ''The Hobbit'' to the same epic level as ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''. ==Portrayal in adaptations== ===Films=== '''2012: ''[[The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey]]'':''' :In trying to convince [[Bilbo Baggins|Bilbo]] of his [[Tooks|Tookishness]], [[Gandalf]] tells about the story of the [[Battle of Greenfields]], referring to Golfimbul as a Goblin-king. ===Games=== '''2007: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':''' :In [[Brockenborings]] there is a wooden statue depicting Bandobras standing in a golf pose over Golfimbul's head. Every Spring, [[the Shire]] celebrates Bullroarer Took Day when the Hobbits place tankards of the drink under his statue in his honor. :The epic book prologue in the Shire involves the player trying to thwart '''Lubach''', who believes that he is the descendant of Golfimbul, from invading the Shire with a group of Goblins. He dwells in a landmark in the Greenfields referred to as '''Golfimbul's Hole'''. {{references}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Golfimbul}} {{seq-start}} {{seq-head | name=Golfimbul | race=orc | house= | born= | died={{TA|2747}} }} {{seq | prev=unknown | list=King of the [[Goblins]] of [[Mount Gram]] | dates=unknown - {{TA|2747}} | next=unknown (possibly none) }} {{seq-end}} [[Category:Characters in The Hobbit]] [[Category:Orcs]] [[Category:Rulers in Middle-earth]] [[Category:Third Age characters]] [[de:Golfimbul]] [[fi:Golfimbul]]
